snippet: According to a court memorandum, Ramzi Ahmed Yousef, the terrorist who was convicted for planning the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, wanted to talk to authorities in 2010.
abstract: Court memorandum cited by a judge in Manhattan indicates that terrorist Ramzi Ahmed Yousef, who is serving a life sentence for orchestrating the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, wanted to cooperate with authorities; few details available are a reminder that after two decades of terrorism prosecutions, questions remain about what secrets terrorists still keep when they are shipped off to maximum security prisons.
lead_paragraph: According to a court memorandum, Ramzi Ahmed Yousef, the terrorist who was convicted for planning the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, wanted to talk to authorities in 2010.

headline.seo: Few Details Are Given on An Offer by Ramzi Ahmed Yousef to Cooperate
headline.main: Mystery in Offer by Terrorist to Cooperate
headline.print_headline: Mystery In Offer By Terrorist To Cooperate
